str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Strengthened from the base of trope; to twist, i.e. Turn quite around or reverse.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Apparently a primary word; a female child, or descendant.
Of Hebrew origin; Hierusalem, the capitol of Palestine.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
However, nevertheless, but, except that, yet. From pleion; moreover, i.e. Albeit, save that, rather, yet.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.

str2: Himself, herself, itself.
And, even, also, namely.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
